item.title: Reflections on RStudio::conf2018
item.description: photo up top We’re driving north on I-5, passing brown hills and palm trees, San Deigo in the rear view. The smell of last night’s beach bonfire on our jackets in the back seat wafts up front, and Google Maps tells us we’re 7 hours from our destination: Berkeley and Davis, CA. For the past two days, we attended RStudio::conf2018, a gathering of about 1,500 R users, programmers, data scientics, academics, and tidyverse hex sticker afficionados.

item.title: What I learned at rstudio::conf
item.description: Workflow tidyverse multilingual rmd packages programming with dplyr always think about your user Packages infer sf tidygraph & ggraph tibbletime Inspiration Making a package Making a blog (this blog!) Quick and dirty Provocations Visual inference Itches scratched tensorflow Food, Hexes, and Sunshine Such a relaxing conference. Instead of everyone challenging each other, people were so excited to discuss methods and workflows and ideas.

item.title: About
item.description: Niklas Lollo PhD Student Energy and Resources Group, UC Berkeley NSF NRT Fellow, Data Science for the 21st Century See my website for more information.
